document.docAuthor: Grubbs, Scott A. & Baumann, Richard W.
document.masterDocTitle: Soyedina Ricker, 1952 (Plecoptera: Nemouridae) in the eastern Nearctic: review of species concepts, proposed morphology-based species groups, and description of a new species from North Carolina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Soyedina Ricker, 1952 (Plecoptera: Nemouridae) in the eastern Nearctic: review of species concepts, proposed morphology-based species groups, and description of a new species from North Carolina

bibRefCitation.author: Baumann, R. W. & Grubbs, S. A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Baumann, R. W. & Grubbs, S. A. (1996) Two new species of Soyedina (Plecoptera: Nemouridae) from the Appalachian Mountains. Entomological News, 107, 220 - 224. Available from: http: // biodiversitylibrary. org / page / 270049 8 (accessed 21 August 2019)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Soyedina kondratieffi
Baumann & Grubbs 1996:220
. Holotype ♂ (USNM), upper Ball Creek , Coweeta Hydrologic Laboratory , Macon Co. , North Carolina , USA

Distribution. USA : MD , NC (
DeWalt et al . 2019
), TN (
Verdone et al . 2017
, p. 36).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 51–56 .
Soyedina amicalola
. 51-56: USA: Georgia, Frogtown Creek. 51, epiproct, ventral view, 800X; 52, epiproct, lateral view, 800X; 53, epiproct apex, apical view, 2000X; 54, epiproct, caudal view, 2000X; 55, epiproct apex, caudal view, 3500X; 56, outer paraproct lobe, lateral view, 500X. ds = dorsal sclerite, vs = ventral sclerite, im = inner member, opl = outer paraproct lobe.

FIGURES 57–64 .
Soyedina kondratieffi
. 57, 59–60, 62–63: USA, Maryland, Mill Run; 59, 61, 64: USA, North Carolina, Ball Creek. 57, epiproct, ventral view, 270X; 58, epiproct, ventral view, 354X; 59, epiproct apex, ventral view, 650X; 60, epiproct apex, dorsal view, 850X; 61, epiproct, lateral view, 347X; 62, epiproct, caudal view, 370X; 63, outer paraproct lobe, lateral view, 300X; 64, outer paraproct lobe, lateral view, 262X. ds = dorsal sclerite, vs = ventral sclerite, im = inner member.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Adults were described in Baumann & Grubbs (1996) ; the larva remains undescribed. The near-symmetric dorsal ( Figs. 57–59, 62 ) and ventral ( Figs. 57–59 ) sclerites, plus the paired, concave inner epiproct members ( Figs. 57, 59–60 ) of the epiproct, are unique among the eastern Nearctic species of this genus. In addition, in lateral view the dorsal sclerites ( Fig. 61 ) are markedly more robust compared to the other eastern Nearctic species (e.g. Figs. 21 , 29 ). Similar to
S. amicalola
, the placement of
S. kondratieffi
into a species group is problematic.

Verdone et al . (2017)
reported four additional localities of this species from Great Smoky Mountains National Park ( GRSM ). This included three localities from Tennessee , representing new (but expected) state records. Two additional GRSM records are noted above and this species is also reported from Virginia for the first time. We anticipate
S. kondratieffi
is in West Virginia , too.
Soyedina kondratieffi
is currently known only from small disjunct geographic areas in western Maryland , east Tennessee , western North Carolina , and western Virginia ( Fig. 81 ).
